intro: Silene microsperma subsp. microsperma, commonly known as the small-seeded catchfly, is a flowering plant in the Caryophyllaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial with slender, ascending stems and small, pink to reddish-purple flowers. The plant produces numerous tiny, capsule-like fruits that contain minute seeds. It typically grows in dry, open habitats such as sandy soils and disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
